types.name: Article
types.description:
Represents a single content story

An article represents a structured piece of information composed of one or more
content elements (text, video, etc) that provides a coherent piece of information

fields.name: meta
fields.description: Meta information about the Article

fields.name: metaPage
fields.description: SEO Meta information about the article

fields.name: category
fields.description: Represents the category of the content

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The unique identifier of the Article

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the Article

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of the Article which usually containst summary of the contents

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: A static image representative of the Article

fields.name: url
fields.description: The relative path on the domain where the detail page for the Article is located

fields.name: roofline
fields.description: The roofline parsed with article data

fields.name: parts
fields.description: The parts of an article, which are composed of text, images, videos, etc. Check ArticleParts for more details

fields.name: disableCommercial
fields.description: This filed allow to disable commercials in the article if necessary

fields.name: entityID
fields.description: CMS entity ID

fields.name: headline
fields.description: The headline of the article, which is usually a small introduction to the article

fields.name: sponsor
fields.description: Article sponsor

fields.name: knowMore
fields.description: The Knowmore field return athletes, noc and disciplines related with the article

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: ArticleParts
types.description: The parts of an article, which are composed of text, images, videos, etc

types.name: AthletePage
types.description: Represents the athlete page

fields.name: athlete
fields.description: Athlete entity. Check Athlete for more details

fields.name: replays
fields.description: The athlete's video replays

fields.name: content
fields.description: Content related to the athlete. Check AthletePageContent for more details

fields.name: featured
fields.description: Featured Athletes related to the athlete

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: CoverPage
types.description: Represents the cover page

fields.name: breaking
fields.description:
Represents an editorially selected set of content which is considered breaking news / stories
Does not currently exist on OC.com

fields.name: motto
fields.description:
A single piece of content that represents the current motto of the olympics.
Corresponds to motto on OC.com

fields.name: highlights
fields.description:
Represents an editorially selected set of content which is considered to be highlighted to draw reader attention (promotions, etc)
Corresponds to Hero Module on OC.com

fields.name: topStories
fields.description:
Represents an editorially selected set of content which is considered to be the most relevant stories at the moment
Corresponds to Mosaic Module on OC.com

fields.name: latestStories
fields.description:
Represents an editorially selected set of content which is considered to be the most recent stories
Corresponds to "News section" on OC.com

fields.name: originals
fields.description: Retrieves a selection of Original Series

fields.name: events
fields.description:
Represents an editorially selected set of events taking place now or in the future
Corresponds to "Events section" on OC.com

fields.name: liveStreams
fields.description: Fetch all live streaming available at the moment

fields.name: replays
fields.description: Retrieves a selection of replays

fields.name: other
fields.description:
Represent other editorial selections of content relevant
Corresponds to all other named sections on OC.com (originals, events, etc)

types.name: GameTeam
types.description: An entry representing a team of athletes in a game

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique id of the team

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title

fields.name: country
fields.description: Country

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: Country code

fields.name: athleteIds
fields.description: Collection with the ids of the members of the team

fields.name: athletes
fields.description:
Collection of the athletes members of the team.
The parameter resolveIfNumberOfMembersEqual is used to specify the number of members for which I want to resolve the athletes. If not provided, it will resolve the athletes for all the teams.
E.g. if "resolveIfNumberOfMembersEqual: [2, 3]", it will resolve the athlete entity for those teams whose number of members is 2 or 3

types.name: Rank
types.description: Overall position of the participant in the event

fields.name: position
fields.description: Position to display in the client, it could be multiple in a group of results, e.g. 2 athletes with position 3

fields.name: order
fields.description: Order to sort the display in the client, it should be unique in a group of results

fields.name: equal
fields.description: Flag to show the = character with the position

types.name: Image
types.description: Media description and information for an image

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the image

fields.name: alt
fields.description: An alternative text for the image for accesibility

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description for the image

fields.name: urlTemplate
fields.description: The templated url of the image in cloudinary format

fields.name: format
fields.description: The format of the image

fields.name: credits
fields.description: The copyright/credits of the image

fields.name: displayPreferences
fields.description: The display preferences

types.name: ImageDisplayPreferences
types.description: Visualization preferences for the Image

fields.name: position
fields.description:
Indicates which part of the image to focus on. It uses Cloudinary Gravity transformation.
By default no transformation will be performed on the Cloudinary url.

fields.name: imageRatio
fields.description:
Indicates the image aspect ratio (ar_) and crops the non-visible part of the image (c_)
By default no transformation will be performed on the Cloudinary url.

fields.name: hideCaption
fields.description: Indicates if the image should show its caption

fields.name: wideMode
fields.description: Indicates if the image has to use 100% of the placeholder (not 100% of the screen)

types.name: ImagePosition
types.description: Position for the image

types.name: ImageRatio
types.description: Image ratio possibilities

types.name: Meta
types.description:
Represents meta information about an entity, that is, information
that refers to the entity itself and not to the content it represents

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The unique ID of the entity

fields.name: author
fields.description: The author of the story

fields.name: metaTitle
fields.description: The meta title of the entity for SEO purposes

fields.name: metaDescription
fields.description: The meta description for SEO purposes

fields.name: tags
fields.description: A list of tags that associates the content under a given label

fields.name: creationDateTime
fields.description: The entry date and time of creation

fields.name: lastModifiedDateTime
fields.description: The entry last date and time of modification

fields.name: url
fields.description: The base root url for the entity on the domain

fields.name: canonicalUrl
fields.description: The canonical absolute url for the entity

fields.name: theme
fields.description: The theme to be used when rendering the topic page

fields.name: wcmLink
fields.description: The link to edit the entity in the Web Content Management System if available.

fields.name: fullSizeCoverImage
fields.description: Full size Cover Image

types.name: Original
types.description:
An Original is a entity encompasing an original production series for the Olympic Channel
and can be thought of in an equivalent way as a TV Show, with seasons and episodes in each season.

fields.description: Display title

Retrieves a list of athletes given their external ids.

The athletes ids will be checked against three different sources: olympedia, tokyo odf and beijing odf.

fields.description: Retrieves a list of sports disciplines defined in the CMS (paginated)

fields.name: disciplinePage
fields.description: Retrieves content use to render a discipline complete page. Discipline identified by his code

fields.name: channels
fields.description:
Retrieves channels available for a country.

Only channels that are available for the country will be returned. [x-country-code] header will be used to identify the user country.

linearOnly filter for linear channels only, is optional.

fields.name: article
fields.description: Retrieves an article by slug

fields.name: olympicGames
fields.description: Retrieves all content that belongs to olympic experience

fields.description: Group. Here you can find all the queries related to sections and their content.

fields.description: Retrieves OcsEvents overlapping (completely or partially) with time range defined by startData and endDate; optionally, can be filtered by discipline code

fields.name: event
fields.description: Retrieves one OcsEvent identified by its slug

fields.name: liveStreams
fields.description:
Retrieves a list of EPG overlapping (completely or partially) with time range defined by startData and endDate.

Optionally, can be filtered by discipline code, linear channels and/or airingId.

fields.description: Retrieves a single EPG identified by slug

fields.description: Retrieves all content that belongs to the event home page

fields.description: Retrieves a list of VODs that match the provided tags ordered by ContentDate

fields.name: clips
fields.description: Retrieves a list of VODs tagged with any of the following: newsclip/feature/originalseriesepisode/highlightsclip and can be optionally filtered by duration limit.

fields.name: podcastPage
fields.description: Retrieves the podcasts page

fields.description: Retrieves a list of podcasts (paginated)

fields.name: podcast
fields.description: Retrieves all details of a podcast identified by slug

fields.name: original
fields.description: Retrieves an original series details with all seasons and episodes included

fields.name: originalsPage
fields.description: Retrieves the originals page

fields.name: gameDiscipline
fields.description:
Retrieves the details of a discipline from a specific Olympic Games.

You need to provide the OG slug and the SDW discipline slug.

fields.name: gameEvent
fields.description:
Retrieves the event details of a discipline from a specific Olympic Games.

You need to provide the OG slug and the SDW discipline and event slug.

fields.description: Retrieves the user personalized content

types.name: Tag
types.description:
A tag represents a label assigned to an entity for the purpose of identification and additional information
Tags are used to group related content or entities together under a given label

fields.name: slug

fields.name: text
fields.description: The text value of the tag (i.e. the label)

fields.name: hidden
fields.description: The tag should display its link

fields.name: meta
fields.description: Meta information about the text block

fields.name: content
fields.description: The contents of the block of text in markdown format

types.name: TopicPage
types.description:
A entry representing a topic page.
A topic page represents a set of related content of different types curated by editorial
for a particular topic or theme.

fields.name: meta
fields.description: Meta information about the TopicPage

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The unique identifier of the topic page

fields.name: metaTitle
fields.description: The meta title of the topic page for SEO purposes

fields.name: metaDescription
fields.description: The meta description for SEO purposes

fields.name: title
fields.description: The main title of the topic page

fields.name: headline
fields.description: A headline for the topic page

fields.name: image
fields.description: The main image associated with the topic page

fields.name: templateType
fields.description: The template type the editor has choosen for the topic page

fields.name: sponsor
fields.description: Who is sponsoring the topic page

fields.name: creationTime
fields.description: The date and time the topic page was created

fields.name: updateTime
fields.description: The date and time the topic page was modified for the last time

fields.name: author
fields.description: The author of the topic page

fields.name: textBlocks
fields.description:
An ordered array of text blocks of the topic page
Empty (null) results are used to signify that the appropriate TextBlock slot is empty.
For example: [{TextBlock}, null, {TextBlock}, null] will mean the editorial team has deemed
positions 0 and 2 to be filled in while position 1 and 3 are purposedly left empty.

fields.name: quotes
fields.description:
An ordered array of quote blocks of the topic page
Empty (null) results are used to signify that the appropriate SocialMediaFeed slot is empty.
For example: [{Quote}, null, {Quote}, null] will mean the editorial team has deemed
positions 0 and 2 to be filled in while position 1 and 3 are purposedly left empty.

fields.name: socialMediaFeeds
fields.description:
An ordered array of social media feeds of the topic page
Empty (null) results are used to signify that the appropriate SocialMediaFeed slot is empty.
For example: [{SocialMediaFeed}, null, {SocialMediaFeed}, null] will mean the editorial team has deemed
positions 0 and 2 to be filled in while position 1 and 3 are purposedly left empty.

fields.name: contentLists
fields.description:
An ordered array of scontent lists of the topic page
Empty (null) results are used to signify that the appropriate ContentList slot is empty.
For example: [{ContentList}, null, {ContentList}, null] will mean the editorial team has deemed
positions 0 and 2 to be filled in while position 1 and 3 are purposedly left empty.

fields.name: mosaics
fields.description:
An ordered array of scontent lists of the topic page
Empty (null) results are used to signify that the appropriate ContentList slot is empty.
For example: [{ContentList}, null, {ContentList}, null] will mean the editorial team has deemed
positions 0 and 2 to be filled in while position 1 and 3 are purposedly left empty.

fields.name: featuredAthletes
fields.description:
An ordered array of athlete lists of the topic page
Empty (null) results are used to signify that the appropriate athlete list slot is empty.
For example: [{Athlete}, null, {Athlete}, null] will mean the editorial team has deemed
positions 0 and 2 to be filled in while position 1 and 3 are purposedly left empty.

fields.name: carousels

An ordered array of scontent lists of the topic page
Empty (null) results are used to signify that the appropriate ContentList slot is empty.
For example: [{ContentList}, null, {ContentList}, null] will mean the editorial team has deemed
positions 0 and 2 to be filled in while position 1 and 3 are purposedly left empty.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

directives.name: client
directives.description: Direct the client to resolve this field locally, either from the cache or local resolvers.

args.name: always
args.description:
When true, the client will never use the cache for this value. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#forcing-resolvers-with-clientalways-true

directives.name: export
directives.description:
Export this locally resolved field as a variable to be used in the remainder of this query. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#using-client-fields-as-variables

args.name: as
args.description: The variable name to export this field as.

directives.name: connection
directives.description:
Specify a custom store key for this result. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/advanced/caching/#the-connection-directive

args.name: filter
args.description: An array of query argument names to include in the generated custom store key.
